kin.sdk

Interface KinAccount


  • public interface KinAccount
    Represents an account which holds Kin.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ListenerRegistration addAccountCreationListener(EventListener<java.lang.Void> listener)
      Creates and adds listener for account creation event, use returned ListenerRegistration to stop listening.
      ListenerRegistration addBalanceListener(EventListener<Balance> listener)
      Creates and adds listener for balance changes of this account, use returned ListenerRegistration to stop listening.
      ListenerRegistration addPaymentListener(EventListener<PaymentInfo> listener)
      Creates and adds listener for payments concerning this account, use returned ListenerRegistration to stop listening.
      kin.utils.Request<Transaction> buildTransaction(java.lang.String publicAddress, java.math.BigDecimal amount, int fee)
      Build a Transaction object of the given amount in kin, to the specified public address.
      kin.utils.Request<Transaction> buildTransaction(java.lang.String publicAddress, java.math.BigDecimal amount, int fee, java.lang.String memo)
      Build a Transaction object of the given amount in kin, to the specified public address and with a memo(that can be empty or null).

      Build a Transaction object of the given amount in kin, to the specified public address.

    • Method Detail

      • getPublicAddress

        @Nullable
java.lang.String getPublicAddress()
        Returns:
        String the public address of the account, or null if deleted

      • buildTransaction

        kin.utils.Request<Transaction> buildTransaction(@NonNull
                                                java.lang.String publicAddress,
                                                @NonNull
                                                java.math.BigDecimal amount,
                                                int fee)
        Build a Transaction object of the given amount in kin, to the specified public address.

        See buildTransactionSync(String, BigDecimal, int) for possibles errors

        Parameters:
        publicAddress - the account address to send the specified kin amount.
        amount - the amount of kin to transfer.
        fee - the amount of fee(in stroops) for this transfer.
        Returns:
        Request<TransactionId>, TransactionId - the transaction identifier.

      • buildTransaction

        kin.utils.Request<Transaction> buildTransaction(@NonNull
                                                java.lang.String publicAddress,
                                                @NonNull
                                                java.math.BigDecimal amount,
                                                int fee,
                                                @Nullable
                                                java.lang.String memo)
        Build a Transaction object of the given amount in kin, to the specified public address and with a memo(that can be empty or null).

        See buildTransactionSync(String, BigDecimal, int, String) for possibles errors

        Parameters:
        publicAddress - the account address to send the specified kin amount.
        amount - the amount of kin to transfer.
        fee - the amount of fee(in stroops) for this transfer.
        memo - An optional string, can contain a utf-8 string up to 21 bytes in length, included on the transaction record.
        Returns:
        Request<TransactionId>, TransactionId - the transaction identifier

      • sendTransaction

        @NonNull
kin.utils.Request<TransactionId> sendTransaction(Transaction transaction)
        Create Request for signing and sending a transaction

        See sendTransactionSync(Transaction) for possibles errors

        Parameters:
        transaction - is the transaction object to send.
        Returns:
        Request<TransactionId>, TransactionId - the transaction identifier.

      • sendWhitelistTransaction

        @NonNull
kin.utils.Request<TransactionId> sendWhitelistTransaction(java.lang.String whitelist)
        Create Request for signing and sending a transaction from a whitelist. whitelist a transaction means that the user will not pay any fee(if your App is in the Kin whitelist)

        See sendWhitelistTransactionSync(String) for possibles errors

        Parameters:
        whitelist - is the whitelist data (got from the server) which will be used to send the transaction.
        Returns:
        Request<TransactionId>, TransactionId - the transaction identifier.

      • buildTransactionSync

        Transaction buildTransactionSync(@NonNull
                                 java.lang.String publicAddress,
                                 @NonNull
                                 java.math.BigDecimal amount,
                                 int fee)
                          throws OperationFailedException
        Build a Transaction object of the given amount in kin, to the specified public address.

        Note: This method accesses the network, and should not be called on the android main thread.

        Parameters:
        publicAddress - the account address to send the specified kin amount.
        amount - the amount of kin to transfer.
        fee - the amount of fee(in stroops) for this transfer.
        Returns:
        a Transaction object which also includes the transaction id.
        Throws:
        AccountNotFoundException - if the sender or destination account was not created.
        OperationFailedException - other error occurred.

      • buildTransactionSync

        Transaction buildTransactionSync(@NonNull
                                 java.lang.String publicAddress,
                                 @NonNull
                                 java.math.BigDecimal amount,
                                 int fee,
                                 @Nullable
                                 java.lang.String memo)
                          throws OperationFailedException
        Build a Transaction object of the given amount in kin, to the specified public address and with a memo(that can be empty or null).

        Note: This method accesses the network, and should not be called on the android main thread.

        Parameters:
        publicAddress - the account address to send the specified kin amount.
        amount - the amount of kin to transfer.
        fee - the amount of fee(in stroops) for this transfer.
        memo - An optional string, can contain a utf-8 string up to 21 bytes in length, included on the transaction record.
        Returns:
        a Transaction object which also includes the transaction id.
        Throws:
        AccountNotFoundException - if the sender or destination account was not created.
        OperationFailedException - other error occurred.

      • sendTransactionSync

        @NonNull
TransactionId sendTransactionSync(Transaction transaction)
                                    throws OperationFailedException
        send a transaction.

        Note: This method accesses the network, and should not be called on the android main thread.

        Parameters:
        transaction - is the transaction object to send.
        Returns:
        TransactionId the transaction identifier.
        Throws:
        AccountNotFoundException - if the sender or destination account was not created.
        InsufficientKinException - if account balance has not enough kin.
        TransactionFailedException - if transaction failed, contains blockchain failure details.
        OperationFailedException - other error occurred.

      • sendWhitelistTransactionSync

        @NonNull
TransactionId sendWhitelistTransactionSync(java.lang.String whitelist)
                                             throws OperationFailedException
        send a whitelist transaction. whitelist a transaction means that the user will not pay any fee(if your App is in the Kin whitelist)

        Note: This method accesses the network, and should not be called on the android main thread.

        Parameters:
        whitelist - is the whitelist data (got from the server) which will be used to send the transaction.
        Returns:
        TransactionId the transaction identifier.
        Throws:
        AccountNotFoundException - if the sender or destination account was not created.
        InsufficientKinException - if account balance has not enough kin.
        TransactionFailedException - if transaction failed, contains blockchain failure details.
        OperationFailedException - other error occurred.

      • getBalance

        @NonNull
kin.utils.Request<Balance> getBalance()
        Create Request for getting the current confirmed balance in kin

        See getBalanceSync() for possibles errors

        Returns:
        Request<Balance> Balance - the balance in kin

      • getBalanceSync

        @NonNull
Balance getBalanceSync()
                         throws OperationFailedException
        Get the current confirmed balance in kin

        Note: This method accesses the network, and should not be called on the android main thread.

        Returns:
        the balance in kin
        Throws:
        AccountNotFoundException - if account was not created
        OperationFailedException - any other error

      • getStatusSync

        int getStatusSync()
           throws OperationFailedException
        Get current account status on blockchain network.
        Returns:
        account status, either AccountStatus.NOT_CREATED, or AccountStatus.CREATED
        Throws:
        OperationFailedException - any other error

      • getStatus

        kin.utils.Request<java.lang.Integer> getStatus()
        Create Request for getting current account status on blockchain network.

        See getStatusSync() for possibles errors

        Returns:
        account status, either AccountStatus.NOT_CREATED, or AccountStatus.CREATED

      • addBalanceListener

        ListenerRegistration addBalanceListener(@NonNull
                                        EventListener<Balance> listener)
        Creates and adds listener for balance changes of this account, use returned ListenerRegistration to stop listening.

        Note: Events will be fired on background thread.

        Parameters:
        listener - listener object for payment events

      • addPaymentListener

        ListenerRegistration addPaymentListener(@NonNull
                                        EventListener<PaymentInfo> listener)
        Creates and adds listener for payments concerning this account, use returned ListenerRegistration to stop listening.

        Note: Events will be fired on background thread.

        Parameters:
        listener - listener object for payment events

      • addAccountCreationListener

        ListenerRegistration addAccountCreationListener(EventListener<java.lang.Void> listener)
        Creates and adds listener for account creation event, use returned ListenerRegistration to stop listening.

        Note: Events will be fired on background thread.

        Parameters:
        listener - listener object for payment events

      • export

        java.lang.String export(@NonNull
                        java.lang.String passphrase)
                 throws CryptoException
        Export the account data as a JSON string. The seed is encrypted.
        Parameters:
        passphrase - The passphrase with which to encrypt the seed
        Returns:
        A JSON representation of the data as a string
        Throws:
        CryptoException
